Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, amphora or hydria; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of naked woman, to right, between two men (of female, head, neck and collar bones with added white, added red on fillet and hair band and necklace around neck remaining); on either side of her, tip of beard, possibly with red.
Curator's comments: Beazley and Payne suggest the figures were probably dancing, as on the Late Corinthian neck-amphora British Museum 1977,0501.1. They place the sherd in the time of Sophilos, citing the white added directly to the clay ground.
Bibliographic references: Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 261, no. 27)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 456, no. B767)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0093) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (Pl. 2, no. 1)
